definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: It is a subject that is treated altogether too lightly by the great majority of people.
sentences.chinese: 無奈大多數的人對這個問題都太鄙棄了。

sentences.english: A root is a flower that disdains fame.
sentences.chinese: 花根是鄙棄榮名的花朵。

sentences.english: Stay calm and avoid the appearance of hostility or personal rejection.
sentences.chinese: 保持沉著和避免顯露出敵視或個人的鄙棄。

sentences.english: Such immoral behavior should be criticized and held beneath contempt in the international community.
sentences.chinese: 這種取之不義的做法應該遭到國際社會的批判和鄙棄。

sentences.english: She disdained all my offers of help.
sentences.chinese: 她鄙棄我要幫助她的所有提議。

sentences.english: Yet the solution of some folks is to disdain wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 但一些人給出的應對之道竟是鄙棄智慧。

sentences.english: Thy skill to poet were, thou scorner of the ground!
sentences.chinese: 這就是鄙棄塵土的你啊，你的藝術技巧。

sentences.english: The restraint of home and parental authority he has despised and rebelled against.
sentences.chinese: 家庭的束縛和父母的威望都被他鄙棄並對抗了。
